questions.question_text:
A company uses Azure Site Recovery (ASR) for a VMWare environment that includes the following virtual machines (VMs):
//IMG//

The company reports that they are unable to configure all of the servers for replication.
You need to evaluate the servers and server roles to determine which servers can be protected.
Which server can you protect by using ASR?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The ADC can be protected by ASR
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/site-recovery/site-recovery-active-directory

Selected Answer: D
VM4 for sure, the domain controller without a doubt

Selected Answer: B
based on the link below, the answer should be B instead of D

questions.question_text:
A company uses Azure Backup Server to back up SQL Server databases that are deployed in an availability group.

The company reports that a backup operation for a database fails. The following error message displays:

Unable to configure protection.

You need to ensure that the backup operation runs successfully.

What should you do?

choices.C: Run the following command on the backup server: net stop OBEngine
choices.A: Add a partitioned drive to the storage pool on the backup server.
choices.D: Configure the availability group replicas to allow read and write operations on the SQL Server instance.
choices.B: Add the Sysadmin role to the system account on the SQL Server instance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Performance increase to handle the churns.

B

One can only assume that the target doesn't have P10 disks to match as these disks should easily cope with 10 MB/s. They are rated at 100 MB/s with 170 MB/s burst

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disks-types

questions.question_text:
A company uses Azure Site Recovery (ASR) to replicate and recover Azure virtual machines (VM) between Azure regions.
An administrator receives the following warning from ASR about a VM that uses P10 disks: Data change rate beyond supported limits
You add OS Disk Write Bytes/Sec and Data Disk Write Bytes/Sec to the list of metrics for monitoring. You discover that the VM consistently has a data churn of greater than 8 MB/s but less than 10 MB/s.
You need to resolve the issue.
What should you do?

choices.C: Use AzCopy to upload data to a cache storage account.
choices.A: Uninstall the Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) Provider service.
choices.D: Create a network service endpoint in a virtual network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It should be A (SCVMM). I have worked taking logs from VMM for troubleshooting ASR. I would discard Azure monitor because it is not enabled by default, and there are not specifications that it might be logging anything. I would discard NSGs because ASR communication uses the Internet by default. This traffic does not go by the NSG.

Selected Answer: B
Flow logs are a very good way of checking what happens at L4 level.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/network-watcher/network-watcher-nsg-flow-logging-overview#why-use-flow-logs

Selected Answer: B
B is right.
B and check if outbound traffic is allowed

questions.question_text:
A company has an on-premises application server that runs in System Center Virtual Machine Manager (SCVMM). The company configures Azure Site Recovery.
An administrator at the company reports that they receive an error message. The error message indicates that there are replication issues.
You need to troubleshoot the issue.
Which log should you review?

discussion.content:
Correct. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/backup/backup-azure-troubleshoot-slow-backup-performance-issue
"The following conditions can cause the backup job to run in unoptimized mode:
- First backup (also known as Initial Replication) will always run in unoptimized mode
- If the previous backup job fails, then the next scheduled backup job will run as unoptimized."

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company uses Azure Backup Agent to back up specific files and folders from an on-premises virtual machine (VM).
An administrator reports that the backup job is transferring files slowly. You determine that the backup job is verifying changes in directories by scanning the entire volume.
You need to determine the state of the backup job.
In which state will the backups occur? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//
